{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3544559,"name":"Greg","username":"JoeFizzy","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/958977/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T01:30:34.393Z","cooked":"

Hey Limelight Pros-

We’re having a weird Limelight poseEstimation issue and I’m hoping someone can help me see where we’ve gone wrong. (I’m sorry in advance for the length of this post – I wanted to make sure I provide as much info as possible).

We have two limelight 4s on our robot (one on the front side and one on the back side). We are using the Limelights with YAGSL to update our pose and the “plumbing” for this is working well.

The issue is that our front and rear cameras do not agree on our robot pose (see AdvantageScope screenshot below). The “yellow” ghost is the pose from the “front” camera and the “green” ghost is from the “back” camera. The front camera pose is correct.

AdvantageScope limelight poses1920×1588 113 KB

The two limelights are mounted on the sides of our elevator (the elevator is on the “left” side of the robot. If we’re looking down on the robot from the top, the “x” coordinate (which I’m associating with the LL RIGHT dimension) is the same for both limelights. The “y” coordinates (LL FRONT) are symmetric around the midpoint of the robot.

The Limelight documentation states:

LL Forward, LL Right, and LL Up represent distances along the Robot’s forward, right, and up vectors if you were to embody the robot. (in meters).

We have always assumed that these values are measured from center of the robot. So to get the LL Right dimension, we measured the distance from the center of the robot to the camera lens. This was 9.54" left of the center of the robot, so we configured LL Right to be -0.24225m for both limelights. This is what resulted in the screenshot above.

For testing purposes, we changed the LL Right configuration of the rear limelight from -0.24225 to 0.24225 (basically just inverted the sign). This almost completely eliminated the error between the two poses.

So my question is: How should we be configuring the limelights? Is the position relative to the center of the robot, or something else?

Thanks in advance for your help-

** Current Limelight Configs**

Back Limelight Config1009×531 19.5 KB

Front Limelight Config1030×561 21.8 KB

LimelightHelpers has a method for setting camera location
public void setCamToRobotOffset(VisionConstants.CameraConstants.CameraValues cam) {
LimelightHelpers.setCameraPose_RobotSpace(cam.camname, cam.forward, cam.side, cam.up, cam.roll, cam.pitch, cam.yaw);
}

RobotSpace in Limelight Documentation is defined as

Robot Space​

3d Cartesian Coordinate System with (0,0,0) located at the center of the robot’s frame projected down to the floor.

X+ → Pointing forward (Forward Vector)

Y+ → Pointing toward the robot’s right (Right Vector)

Z+ → Pointing upward (Up Vector)

Thanks for the quick response. I think this is what we are doing (just in the Limelight config GUI, not in code…

To be clear, with a rear facing camera, should the “LL Right” measurement be the same as for a forward facing camera in the same “Y” plane on the robot? (See diagram below)

image960×720 37.8 KB

This is how we have configured our robot, and when we use MegaTag2 to estimate our robot pose, the rear facing camera is always about half a robot’s width right of the robot’s position. The forward facing camera is correct.

I’m wondering if the rear facing camera dimensions should be inverted (assume the rear of the robot is the front), which seems to give a better estimate of position.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2025-03-02T15:41:31.790Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":57,"readers_count":56,"score":21.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":493807,"topic_slug":"limelight-camera-location-configuration","display_username":"Greg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62319,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/limelight-camera-location-configuration/493807/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3544923,"name":"icemannie","username":"icemannie","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/i/bc79bd/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-02T17:07:12.287Z","cooked":"

Our rear facing camera was centered last year so we didn’t have to think about that, but looking at it this way matches your findings.
If your robot front is facing and centered on the tag, your front camera is to the left of the tag. Turn the robot 180 and the same side rear camera is to the right of the same tag.
